action.action-desc: Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Reform

form.official-title: To modify the governmentwide financial management plan, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the CFO Vision Act of 2022.

section.header: Chief financial officers; governmentwide financial management plan

subsection.header: Chief Financial Officer and Deputy Chief Financial Officer
subsection.text: Chapter 9 of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking An and inserting It shall be the duty and responsibility of each agency Chief Financial Officer to oversee and provide leadership in the areas of budget formulation and execution, planning and performance, risk management, internal controls, financial systems, accounting, and other areas as the Director of the Office of Management and Budget may designate. In carrying out the preceding sentence, each;

paragraph.text: A financial management status report under this subsection shall include—

subparagraph.text: a description and analysis of the status of financial management in the executive branch, including the progress made towards implementing the governmentwide 4-year financial management plan, the status of remaining challenges, and, as necessary based on obligations or expenditures, any update or revision to the cost estimates included in the most recent governmentwide 4-year financial management plan;

a summary of the most recently completed financial statements—

clause.text: of Federal agencies under section 3515 of this title; and
of Government corporations;

subparagraph.text: a summary of the most recently completed financial statement audits and reports—

clause.text: of Federal agencies under subsections (e) and (f) of section 3521 of this title; and
of Government corporations;

subparagraph.text: a summary of reports on internal accounting and administrative control systems submitted to the President and Congress under subsection (d);

a listing of agencies whose financial management systems do not comply substantially with the requirements of section 803(a) of the Federal Financial Management Improvement Act of 1996 (31 U.S.C. 3512 note), and a summary statement of the efforts underway to remedy the noncompliance; and
any other information the Director considers appropriate to fully inform Congress regarding the financial management of the Federal Government.

subsection.text: The head of each executive agency shall—

subsection.text: Section 3521 of title 31, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking paragraphs (1) and (2);
by striking (e) Each financial and inserting (e)(1) Each financial;
in paragraph (1), as so designated, by striking standards— and inserting standards.; and
by inserting after paragraph (1), as so designated, the following:

paragraph.text: As part of each audit under this subsection, the auditor shall—

subparagraph.text: evaluate the design of the internal control of the agency over financial reporting and key financial information, as assessed and reported on by the head of the agency under section 3512(d)(2)(C) of this title;
determine whether those controls have been implemented;

for controls that are properly designed and implemented, perform sufficient tests of those controls to conclude whether the controls are operating effectively, including sufficient tests to support a low level of assessed control risk; and

communicate controls that the auditor concludes are not suitably designed and implemented or are not operating effectively, as appropriate under applicable generally accepted government auditing standards.

paragraph.text: Audits under this subsection shall be conducted—

subparagraph.text: in the case of an agency having an Inspector General appointed under the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.), by the Inspector General or by an independent external auditor, as determined by the Inspector General of the agency; and
in any other case, by an independent external auditor, as determined by the head of the agency.

paragraph.text: in subsection (h), by striking section 3512(a)(3)(B)(viii) and inserting section 3512(a)(2)(B)(viii).
